==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|もう|もく|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/maumoku/}} → {{IPAchar|/mɔːmoku/}} → {{IPAchar|/moːmoku/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=もうもく}} compound {{m|zh|盲目|tr=mæng mjuwk|lit=blind + eye}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''maang<sup>4</sup> muk<sup>6</sup>''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|もうもく|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5,NHK}}

===Adjective===
{{ja-adj|もうもく|hhira=まうもく}}

# [[blind]]
#: {{ja-usex|恋は'''盲目'''、'''盲目'''な愛情|こい は '''もうもく'''、 '''もうもく''' な あいじょう|love is '''blind''', '''blind''' love}}

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|もうもく}}

====Usage notes====
Also used with the particle {{ja-r|の}}, as a noun modifying another noun.
* {{ja-usex|'''盲目'''の法師|'''もうもく''' の ほうし|a '''blind''' monk}}

The adjective form with {{ja-r|な}} is used to describe mental or emotional blindness, while the noun form can be used attributively with {{ja-r|の}} to describe physical blindness.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|もうもく|hhira=まうもく}}

# [[blindness]]
